description: The Azure tenant ID that you want to use for your configuration. You can find your tenant ID in the Azure portal or by running the 'az account tenant list' command.
name: tenantId

description: Your Azure subscription ID. You can find your subscription ID in the Azure portal or by running the 'az account subscription list' command.
name: subscriptionId

description: Your Azure Active Directory Client ID. You can find your Client ID in the Azure portal or by running the 'az ad sp list --all' command.
name: aadClientId

description: The location of your Azure hosts. You can find the location of your virtual machines in the Azure portal or by running the 'az vm show' command. For example 'useast'
name: location

description: Your Azure Active Directory Client Secret.
name: aadClientSecret

description: The name of your Azure resource group. You can find your resource group in the Azure portal or by running the 'az group list' command.
name: resourceGroup

description: There are two types of virtual machine i.e. 'standard' and 'VMSS'. The standard VM are listed under virtual machines and the VMSSs' VMs are listed under virtual machine scale set as instances.
name: vmType

description: The security group name. You can find your security group name in the Azure portal by running the 'az network nsg list' command.
name: securityGroupName

description: The name of the virtual network. You can find the name of your virtual network in the Azure portal or by running the 'az network vnet list' command.
name: vnetName
